page.title: 04THE NEWSAGENT
page.content: The second shop that we visited was Martins the newsagents. The owner was called Mr. Martin and he has had his shop for eight years. His day begins at 5.30am. when he receives the day's papers, which are delivered from Sheffield. Three people count the papers and set up the rounds. On their rounds the paper boys cover one to four kilometres and make 45 to 50 deliveries. Papers and magazines are the main bulk of the business. The most expensive items for sale are toys. The busiest periods are Christmas, Easter and Mother's Day. The shop is open from 6.30am. to 5.30pm on weekdays and from 7.30am to 1.00pm on Sundays when they are only allowed to sell newspapers,tobacco and confectionary. Six part-time staff and the owner's wife are employed to serve the 800 to 900 daily customers.
